title: Procedures and Corrective Actions
description: Establishment and maintenance of standardized procedures and systematic approach to handling non-conformances and corrective actions

requirements.text: Is there a written and standardized procedure for creating Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and their content?
mandatoryStatements: Written procedure exists for SOP creation and format
Procedure defines required SOP elements (title, purpose, scope, procedures, records, etc.)
Standardized template or format is specified
Approval and review process for SOPs is defined
Procedure ensures SOPs are clear, actionable, and specific to facility operations
Version control and document identification requirements are specified
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of SOP creation procedure and existing SOPs for compliance with format requirements
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Verification of format compliance for each new or revised SOP before approval

requirements.text: Are the written procedures available to relevant users and is a master copy maintained in a central file?
mandatoryStatements: Written procedures are available to all relevant personnel who need them
Master copies of all procedures are maintained in central location
Master file is controlled and access is restricted
Procedures are accessible in work areas where activities are performed
Controlled copies are distributed to relevant areas
System tracks distribution of controlled copies
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual audit of master file completeness and procedure distribution, quarterly verification of work area procedure availability
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate distribution of new or revised procedures to relevant areas, monthly check of work area procedure currency

requirements.text: Is there a documented corrective action procedure that describes the basic requirements for handling all non-conformances affecting food safety?
mandatoryStatements: Corrective action procedure is documented
Procedure defines what constitutes a non-conformance
Immediate containment actions are specified
Root cause analysis methodology is defined
Corrective action planning and implementation steps are described
Verification of corrective action effectiveness is required
Responsibility and authority for corrective actions are defined
Documentation requirements for corrective actions are specified
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual audit of corrective action procedure and records, quarterly review of corrective action effectiveness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate initiation of corrective action for food safety non-conformances, monthly review of open corrective actions

requirements.text: Is there an incident reporting system, also known as a Notice(s) of Unusual Occurrence and Corrective Actions Log (NUOCA)?
mandatoryStatements: Incident reporting system (NUOCA or equivalent) is established
System captures all unusual occurrences and deviations affecting food safety
Log includes incident description, date, time, responsible party, and immediate actions taken
System tracks corrective actions from initiation to completion
Personnel are trained to recognize and report incidents
Management reviews incident reports regularly
Trend analysis of incidents is conducted to identify systemic issues
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual audit of NUOCA system completeness and effectiveness, quarterly trend analysis of incidents
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily or weekly review of new incidents, monthly verification of corrective action completion

capaInject: If SOP does not meet format requirements: revise SOP to comply with procedure within 14 days, retrain users on revised version
If procedures not available in work areas: provide controlled copies immediately, investigate distribution process failure
If corrective action procedure not followed: immediate correction, investigate why procedure was bypassed, retrain within 7 days
If incidents not reported in NUOCA: conduct immediate training on reporting requirements, implement monitoring to ensure compliance
traceabilityInject: SOP master file must trace all procedure versions and revision history
Corrective action records must trace from initial non-conformance through effectiveness verification
NUOCA log must be traceable to specific incidents, dates, personnel, and resolution
All corrective actions must be traceable to root cause analysis and verification results
